title: New Holland Agriculture Publicly Launches the Industry's First All-Electric Utility Tractor with Autonomous Features ... - PR Newswire
summary: New Holland Agriculture introduces the T4 Electric Power, the first all-electric utility tractor with autonomous features. The tractor is designed to address current farming challenges, such as increased total cost ownership and labor shortage, while delivering upon New Holland's commitment to help customers build more sustainable agriculture. The T4 Electric Power is powered by a state-of-the-art lithium-ion battery pack and delivers 74 hp (55 kW) rated power and 65 hp (48 kW) PTO power.

green_product: TRUE, The T4 Electric Power is a green product because it is a good or service that is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.

title: Prairie Farmer editors: Welcome to 70th FPS - Farm Progress
summary: The Farm Progress Show is a 70-year-old agricultural trade show that showcases new products and innovations in the industry. This year's show will feature hundreds of exhibitors displaying their latest products, including many new products that didn't exist at last year's show. Some of the most popular new technologies at this year's show include autonomous farming machines, electric vehicles, and alternative energy sources.

title: Top 5 Perks Of Embracing Green Computing In Your Company - Spiceworks News and Insights
summary: Green computing, also known as sustainable IT, involves practices that reduce negative environmental externalities of human activity. By implementing green computing practices, businesses can lower energy costs, gain a competitive advantage, strengthen their brand, attract and retain top talent, and increase innovation. Green computing also encompasses designing energy-efficient computers and systems, implementing higher efficiency energy practices in the operation of data centers, and employing sustainable practices in computing and software engineering.

title: Why Are Chocolate Prices Rising? In Part, the Climate Crisis Is to Blame - VegNews
summary: The price of chocolate has increased by around 25% in the last year, due to a combination of factors including flooding in West Africa, which is the source of most of the world's cocoa beans, and the war in Ukraine, which has disrupted the supply chain. The rising cost of cocoa is having a negative impact on cocoa farmers, many of whom are already living in poverty. Some vegan chocolate brands are committed to ethical sourcing and paying farmers a fair price, but these bars are more expensive than the alternatives.
greenwashing: There is no evidence of greenwashing in this article.

title: Decarbonization Opens Pathway to a Sustainable Future - Eetasia.com
summary: Decarbonization is a crucial initiative to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and transition to a sustainable, low-carbon economy. The semiconductor industry is actively involved in developing innovative solutions to reduce GHG emissions, improve energy efficiency, and promote the adoption of renewable energy sources. Companies like Intel and Infineon are investing in research and development to create greener products and processes, while Salient Energy is exploring alternative battery technologies to support the transition to electric mobility.

title: Hy-fcell Conference Will Highlight Prospects in The Energy Sector - Hydrogen Central
summary: The hy-fcell Conference will be held in Stuttgart, Germany, on September 13 and 14, 2023. The conference will feature over 60 speakers and 25 sessions on the latest developments in the hydrogen and fuel cell industry. The conference will also include an exhibition of products and services from leading companies in the industry.

title: Hendrickson all set to revolutionize Indian trailer market – Motorindia - Motorindia
summary: Hendrickson, a global leader in commercial vehicle suspensions and axles, has launched a range of innovative air and mechanical suspensions and axles specifically designed for India's growing trailer industry. These new products are engineered to provide superior ride quality, durability, and cost-effectiveness, and are part of Hendrickson's commitment to delivering tailored solutions to meet the evolving needs of the Indian market. Hendrickson is also exploring opportunities presented by electrification and is embracing composite materials to reduce weight and enhance features.

title: Komatsu: Driving innovation, enhancing safety - Mining Review Africa
summary: Komatsu, the world's largest producer of electric mining equipment, is committed to safety and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The company places great emphasis on research and development (R&D) and collaborates with its customers to develop new technologies. Komatsu's focus on sustainability, safety and productivity is evident in its product development roadmap which runs to 2040.
